author: samcm
content:
Posting some `pectra-devnet-3` block arrival analysis across 2 time windows to check if the deposit queue tests <@808969530608451584> has been conducting made an impact to block production

Methodology:
- Subscribe to `block` events on all consensus clients
- For each block proposal, get the `min(slot_arrival_time)`
- Aggregate all the slots that each node proposed throughout the time window.

**Time window 1: **
Slot 75445 -> 78895
Reason: low deposit queue
Analysis: https://github.com/ethpandaops/xatu-data/blob/0b67b4c3cfe68283744554ae81e1acdd6ef10198/examples/clickhouse/block-arrival/block-arrival-time.ipynb

**Time window 2:**
Slot 89245 -> 92695
Reason: large deposit queue
Analysis: https://github.com/ethpandaops/xatu-data/blob/f378600e7eb56368f4dd9fe38da875edb20eee29/examples/clickhouse/block-arrival/block-arrival-time.ipynb

author: samcm
content:
Conclusion: The `min` and `average` didn't really change across the two time windows which is good, although Nimbus saw a 50ms average increase. Nimbus seems to be an outlier in general with this metric (appreciate any insight here!)

If anyone would like access to the data to run their own analysis please ping your local ethPandaOps member üôá

author: tersec
content: what exactly metric are you using?

author: m.kalinin
content: <@808969530608451584> curious if deposits in the large deposit queue tests were top-ups or new deposits or the mix of the two?

author: pk910
content: we can probably try with the other queues too,  but that will have a bigger effect on the network as it takes waay longer to clear the deposit or consolidation queue

author: m.kalinin
content: cool, so there was no additional stress effect because of sig verifications üëç
